name: Free Tour - The Story of Bucharest (Available in Spanish)
shortDescription:
The Story of Bucharest, that’s how your Bucharest trip starts! Get the pulse of the city with our tour that will give you the basics of Bucharest and local tips. Stroll through more than 500 years of history from the times of Vlad the Impaler aka Dracula to the “golden era” of communism, the ’89 Revolution and today’s protests. Unravel the stories not to be found in guidebooks and explore the city with one of our passionate local guides! 

Get the best of your travel experience with local tips about traditional cuisine, places to hang out or cool events. 

Places we will visit:

  • Unirii square with a perfect view over the Palace of Parliament
  • Manuc’s Inn
  • Stavropoleos Church
  • Victory Avenue
  • National History Museum
  • The National Bank of Romania
  • Macca-Villacrosse Passage
  • University of Bucharest

...and MANY more hidden gems and curiosities that most locals don't even know!

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:

  • This tour is organized by Walkabout Free Tours, the first free tour in town.  
  • Please wear comfortable shoes and clothing and bring a bottle of water

Cost: the tours are tip-based so you can pay whatever you think is appropriate at the end of the tour.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Photo-Walk Tour With Award-Winning Photographer (Available in English)
shortDescription:
This Free Tour is a photographic walking tour of Bucharest during which not only will I be showing you some of the most important and photogenic attractions the city has to offer, but I will make sure to tell you their history and help you capture them in the best way possible - one Instagrammable image/video at a time.
Bucharest is a place full of beauty, history, great design, communist architecture and so much more; all this making it an extremely interesting city to photograph. Therefore it is the perfect place to learn how to step up your social media content game and learn how to take and edit stunning images, Insta stories, and videos that are guaranteed to keep your online following glued to their phones waiting for the next time you post.

We will be covering the central area of Bucharest, the most beautiful sights, the most photogenic streets, the most important landmarks, and some of the hidden gems the city has to offer.

Along the way, I will share with you my secrets for creating memorable content that perfectly depicts the city and your travel experience, how to create Instagram stories people can't wait to watch, what to do with all the photos you don't posts, and how to make your audience into a community.
If you are looking for a tour that perfectly combines the classical historical tour of a city and a photography and social media lesson on how to improve your content creation tours, I am looking forward to being your host. 

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Complete Walking Tour of Bucharest: An Expert-Guided Experience (Available in English)
description:
Discover the rich and diverse history of Bucharest on a walking tour that spans six centuries. From the medieval ages to present day, we will explore the evolution of the city's architecture and uncover the stories behind some of its most significant landmarks. 

Begin by climbing Patriarchy Hill and marvel at the former Palace of the Patriarchate, an exquisite example of Romanian Orthodox architecture, where we will learn about the influence of religion on Romanian culture.

Next, marvel at the beauty of the Unirii Fountains, the longest in the world, before visiting the iconic Palace of Parliament, a massive structure that serves as a reminder of Romania's communist past.

As we will stroll by the Old Princely Court and by the square where medieval justice used to be carried out, feel the weight of history as we imagine the dramatic events that took place there. 

As we step back in time take a look inside Manuc's Inn, a historic hotel that has been welcoming travelers for centuries.

At the National Museum of Romanian History, delve into the country's rich cultural heritage, and admire the intricate frescoes and carvings at Stavropoleos Monastery, a peaceful sanctuary that stands in stark contrast to the bustling city.

Learn about the Ottoman period and how it influenced the city's architecture, then experience the grandeur of the Paris of the East era.

Visit the Palace of the National Military Circle and marvel at its imposing neoclassical facade. Then, satisfy your sweet tooth at Capsa Cake Shop, a legendary pastry shop with over 160 years of history.

Take a look at the Odeon Theatre, a cultural institution that has hosted some of the country's most significant plays and performances and see the wounds of the city left behind by the 2nd World War’s bombing campaigns.  

Stand in Revolution Square, the site of historic events that changed the course of Romania's history. Gaze upon the imposing Central Committee of the Communist Party Building, which served as the headquarters of Romania's oppressive regime.

Finally, visit the Royal Palace, once the residence of Romania's kings and now a fascinating museum that houses precious works of art and artifacts. 

Throughout the tour, we will share captivating stories and insights about the landmarks you visit, leaving you with a newfound appreciation for Bucharest's rich history and vibrant culture.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Little Paris before and now - Free Walking Tour (Available in Spanish)
shortDescription:
Best fun visit. We will walk through the old town that I like very much not to tell the things already known but stories that only we residents know. Along the way we will go along Avenida de la Victoria which is the most famous in my entire city and that hides many things unknown to many. To feel a little better and fit the next stop will be in some hidden places, markets with typical Romanian food. I say no more but some stops, the "must see", The National Theater, The Stavropoleos Church, The National Bank, The Athenaeum, The Royal Palace and many others.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Free Tour! - Kings and Dictators (Available in )
description:
Welcome to Romania, a young country that was once a monarchy and a communist country and had its share of dictators in both political regimes. The free tour of Bucharest introduces you to the changes that appeared in the history of the country from the first kingdom in this territory: Dacia, to post-communist Romania. The tour focuses on Avenida de la Victoria, the first main route in the city since the 17th century and you will see Parisian-inspired buildings that show the bohemian part of our city and also explain why it was called in the past “the little Paris". The free tour of Bucharest begins in the University Square at the statue of the first man who dared to unify all the Romanian countries in 1600, fighting against great powers such as the Ottoman Empire. We will continue to see the Military Circle and Capsa, the oldest bakery in the city, an old princely court now transformed into a theater, the Telephone Palace, Bucharest's first skyscraper, the Royal Palace, now the National Museum of Art and the Romanian Museum . Athenaeum, a wonderful work of art. The free tour of Bucharest will end in the Revolution Square with the story of the last dictator: the communist Nicolae Ceausescu.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Old Town Legends and Stories - BTrip Free Tours (Available in English)
description:
The story of the most famous Romanian, that of Vlad the Impaler best known as Dracula also goes back to the Old Town in Bucharest. This is because the Old Town part of the city is the place where many captivating stories and legends were born over the centuries. With BTrip Free Walking Tours all these stories from Bucharest’s rich past come back to life. Join our free tour and discover all of them on the Old Town Legends and Stories Free Tour! This activity includes: -Manuc’s Inn – first stop -Dracula’s Old Court -Stavropoleos Church -Victoria Avenue -Villa Cross Passage -National Bank of Romania -Lipscani Street -University Square -Coltea -Saint George Church -Manuc’s Inn – last stop

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: From Monarchy to Communism Free Tour (Available in English)
description:
Discover a hidden world of palaces, elegance and intriguing stories with our passionate local guides. We will journey in time from the moment that Romania became a Monarchy to the dark times of communism and the bloody revolution. 

The monarchy shaped Bucharest in a unique way compared to any other city in Romania and today’s urban vibes are bringing it back to life. The “belle epoque” period is the most fascinating of all, bringing impressive architecture that should not be missed during your stay in Bucharest.

Join us to discover the best of Bucharest with our free tour ‘From Monarchy to Communism’!

On the tour, we cover the most important sights and attractions such as

  • Victory Avenue
  • Palace of the National Military Circle
  • Palace of the Telephones
  • Victory and English Passage
  • Romanian Atheneum
  • Palace Music Hall
  • Royal Palace
  • Revolution square

...and MANY more hidden gems and curiosities that most locals don't even know!

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:

  • This tour is organized by Walkabout Free Tours, the first free tour in town.  
  • Please wear comfortable shoes and clothing and bring a bottle of water
  • Cost: the tours are tip-based so you can pay whatever you think is appropriate at the end of the tour.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Historic Center and Communism in Bucharest  (Available in Spanish)
description:
The Historic Center in Bucharest is the oldest part of the city, this is where the development of the city began from 1459. On this tour, you will discover the legend of the founding of the city, the most famous leader in Bucharest, the great fire and about the communist regime in Romania. We will stop at some of the most famous attractions in the city, and we will walk through the oldest park in Bucharest, we will finish in front of the largest Parliament in the world. The tour will be a lively trip to Bucharest's past thanks to the old buildings and the photos of the time that the guides will show you. You are welcome to join our free tour in the Historic Center, we are waiting for you!

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Bucharest From Scratch - Tour with a licensed tour guide (Available in Spanish)
description:
From Kilometer Zero over all of Romania and Romanians in a single route.

 In the first part of this tour we will go through the ancient, medieval and modern history of Romania and Bucharest and the true story of the famous vampire Dracula. We will also talk a little about the economy and culture, religion and education, traditional food and, of course, about typical souvenirs. Also in the second part of the tour, we will examine aspects of people's daily lives. We will know what the Romanians think about the monarchy, about communism and about democracy.

 - If you want to know what it is like to LIVE in Bucharest today? What was LIFE like many years ago? book our tour!

 The tour is organized by a certified guide from the Romanian Ministry of Tourism and will be carried out in small groups (no more than 15 people),

 Your participation in the tour will be possible and guaranteed only with a prior reservation.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end
